content:
vp vacancy - the vp president picks a new vp that needs to be approved by congress
War Powers Act - congress checks decisions of president's emergency powers after 60 days
cabinet secretary approval - chosen by the president and has to be approved by the senate
treaties - require 2/3rds senator approval
presidential veto - congress 2/3rds vote can undo the veto
federal officer appointment - appointed by the president and approved by the senate
take care clause - an executive order can be overturned by congress if they donâ€™t feel that the president is doing what they want by passing a law that redirects it, or the supreme court can overturn it as well
